paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Mean age 77.4 ± 8.2 years, 40 men and 10 women
patients.phenotype: cardiac transthyretin-related amyloidosis (cATTR) with and without polyneuropathy (PNP)

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The NVC measurements revealed 25 patients with presentation of sensorimotor polyneuropathy (19x wtATTR, 6x hATTR)
The group of the remaining 15 patients did not show any sign of polyneuropathy (13 x wtATTR, 2 x hATTR)

functional_data.summary: The study suggests that DPD bone scintigraphy is a useful tool for identification of patients with cATTR and a risk for PNP due to increased DPD soft tissue uptake.

variants.segregation_data: Not explicitly mentioned in the paper.
variants.additional_notes: The study included both wild-type and hereditary forms of TTR-related amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The NVC measurements revealed 25 patients with presentation of sensorimotor polyneuropathy (19x wtATTR, 6x hATTR)
The group of the remaining 15 patients did not show any sign of polyneuropathy (13 x wtATTR, 2 x hATTR)

tables_processed.table_caption: Patients with additional quantitative thoracic SPECT/CT

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding TTR variants and penetrance were extracted.
